meanings.definition: A ticket given to a customer when a sold-out item is restocked.
meanings.sent1: I received a rainchecks for the concert tickets when they ran out.
meanings.sent2: The store offered rainchecks for the popular toy that sold out quickly.
meanings.sent3: The rainchecks for the movie tickets made me feel lucky to get them later.
meanings.sent4: Getting a rainchecks for the limited edition sneakers felt like winning a prize.
meanings.sent5: The rainchecks for the event were like golden tickets to the lucky few.

meanings.definition: To postpone an offer or agreement to a later date.
meanings.sent1: I had to rainchecks my plans to meet my friend due to unexpected work.
meanings.sent2: She decided to rainchecks the job interview until she felt more prepared.
meanings.sent3: He always tries to rainchecks doing his homework, but it catches up with him later.
meanings.sent4: The team had to rainchecks their celebration until after the final game.
meanings.sent5: The company had to rainchecks the product launch due to production delays.
